result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Howard Lee Goodman Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Howard Lee Goodman Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Howard Lee Goodman Sr.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Motion hearing. Defendant was not produced, State failed to file Order to Produce. Discussion placed the record. State provided update regarding failure to file OTP. Defense advised the court regarding testimony. Parties discussed finding of facts as to Defense's motion. Court ordered case adjourned for Motion hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 16. State will file Order to Produce.
Motion hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Proposed Findings of Facts received and filed.  bm

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. Parties address motions filed. Court vacates 08/15/2022 jury trial date. Court further schedules the next court date for a Motion Hearing date, and sets 07/20/2022 deadlien for the state's response. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Howard L. Goodman, Sr - #189172, Stanley Correctional Institution, 100 Corrections Dr, Stanley WI 54768-6500).
Received and Filed. STATES WITNESS LIST
Received and Filed. STATES REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTION
Received and Filed. STATES MOTION IN LIMINE
Received and Filed. DEFENDANTS MOTION IN LIMINE
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress received and filed.  bm
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress received and filed.  bm
Received and Filed. DNA Notice of Intent to Use_1 - Goodman, Howard Lee Sr.pdf

Attorney Jade K Hall in court via zoom, defendant Howard Lee Goodman not in court, in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials and an offer from the State. Defense further request Final Pre-Trial and Jury Trial dates. Court adjourns matter and sets 07/27/2022 deadline for filing trial documents. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in custody.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court with Attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 11CF4216. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Stewart. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Arraignment scheduled for March 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for LEVEL 4 Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Howard Lee Goodman in custody.  Karen Lynch Vespalec appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
